firemon_api.core.endpoint¶

class firemon_api.core.endpoint.BaseEndpoint(api: FiremonAPI, app: App, record: BaseRecord | JsonField | None = None)¶

Bases: object

Represents a Basic Endpoint

ep_name = None¶
url = None¶
class firemon_api.core.endpoint.Endpoint(api: FiremonAPI, app: App, record: Record | JsonField | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseEndpoint

Represent actions available on endpoints beyond just a base

Parameters:

  • api (obj) – FiremonAPI()

  • app (obj) – App()

  • record (obj) – optional Record to use

all() → list[Record]¶

Get all Record

count() → int¶

Returns the count of objects available. If there is a ‘count’ at an endpoint that is used. Remember that this is domain dependant and if an Endpoint requires a domain we are using that.

create(*args, **kwargs) → Record¶

Creates an object on an endpoint.

Parameters:

args (dict) – optional. a dictionary of all the needed options

Keyword Arguments:

(str) – keywords and args to create a new record

Returns:

Record

Return type:

(obj)

filter(*args, **kwargs) → list[Record]¶

Attempt to use the filter options. This is the generic Endpoint filter.

get(*args, **kwargs) → Record¶

Get single Record

Parameters:

  • *args (int) – (optional) id to retrieve. If this is not type(int) dump it into filter and grind it up there.

  • **kwargs (str) – (optional) see filter() for available filters

Examples

Get by ID

>>> fm.sm.centralsyslogs.get(12)
new york

Get by partial name. Case insensative.

>>> fm.sm.centralsyslogs.get(name='detro')
detroit
class firemon_api.core.endpoint.EndpointCpl(api: FiremonAPI, app: App, record: Record | JsonField | None = None)¶

Bases: BaseEndpoint

Represent actions available on Control Panel

Parameters:

  • api (obj) – FiremonAPI()

  • app (obj) – App()

  • record (obj) – optional Record to use

FireMon-API is a Python web wrapper for the FireMon SIP (Security Mangager, etc...) APIs. The intent is make something that is useful for quick and easy development against FireMon products.
